issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Nothing to really say about it but the below output speaks for itself

{code}
euca-describe-groups --filter owner-id=080841048930
usage: euca-describe-groups [--show-empty-fields]
                            [--region USER@REGION | -U URL] [-I KEY_ID]
                            [-S KEY] [--filter NAME=VALUE] [--debug]
                            [--debugger] [--version] [-h]
                            [GROUP [GROUP ...]]
euca-describe-groups: error: argument --filter: invalid <functools.partial object at 0x1b85158> value: 'owner-id=080841048930'
{code}

Can we say that filtering works across the board with all the eu* commands ? 

Cheers!
Deependra
fields.summary: euca-describe-groups does not accept owner id filter

comments.body: If you are OK. The pull request is here https://github.com/eucalyptus/euca2ools/pull/28/files

Fixed in 65eabbe:

{noformat}
% euca-describe-group --filter owner-id=000000000000

Thanks for the patch!

Fix verified

Installed Packages
Name        : euca2ools
Arch        : noarch
Version     : 3.0.1
Release     : 0.0.104.el6
